column4: hey all, I have a rather interesting question...  I set up a usb key to install  desktop-amd64.  I can start the installer just fine but when it gets to "scan hard drives for an installer ISO image"  it fails saying it can't read from my cdrom
i can open the shell... and the iso I want is  in /hd-media
but I can't convince the installer to look there.. any ideas?
oh wait a it.
/dev/loop0 is already mounted as /cdrom and it appears to be the iso image
is there a way to tell what image the installer is looking for?
I made sure to use amd64 images..
for the img and the iso
maybe it's not the iso
arg.. yes.. so the iso I need is mounted at /cdrom, it seems to be intact.. I will try installing from the command line to see what the installer is really after.
yes please
do you know where to look for the installer debug logs?
I can find out
try /var/log/debug
I'm pretty sure there wasn't a debug in /var/log when I checked, but I'll look again
debug is a file in /var/log  "cd /var/log"
sure
ls -la debug
did you find it?
i tried to start  "expert install" but it seems to have hung while loading the image
there is only syslog in /var/log
